Tool Status

  • Production
  • Installation
  • Maintenance
  • Idle

Cumulative Analytics For Lab

Productive Time in% =
Productive Time in hrs from start date / Total time in hours(Production/Installation/Config/Maintenance)
* 100
Maintenance Time in% =
Maintenance Time in hours from start date / Total time in hours(Production/Installation/Config/Maintenance)
* 100
Idle Time in% =
Idle Time in hours from start date / Total time in hours(Production/Installation/Config/Maintenance)
* 100
Installation /config Time in% =
Installation/config in hours from start date / Total time in hours(Production/Installation/Config/Maintenance)
* 100

Note:- Idle Time for Day = 24 hours â€“ ( Total hours of Production + Total hours of Installation + Total hours of Maintenance)

Concept & Proto Lab

The floor plan contains the real-time status of all the bays/tools in the C&P lab. The which are in productive state is highlighted in green . Similarly for idle state in red ,install/config in yellow and maintenance in blue.

Productive :- It defines the working or action state of the tool. When tool is being used ,user/tool-owner has to change the status to productive mode.

Idle :- It defines the time associated with waiting or when the piece of machinery is not being used for the given moment.
So when tool is not being used ,user/tool-owner has to change the status to idle mode.

Maintenance :- Maintenance tends to follow the planned guidelines from time-to-time to ensure efficient and best condition of the machinery. During this period the administrator/user/tool-owner has to change the status to maintenance mode.

Installation/config :- At this state any additional equipments required to be added or changed of the machinery/tool is done during this period. Hence administrator/user/tool-owner has to change status to installation during this timeline.

Vacant :- In the dashboard layout, empty or white spaces don't represent any state. Those tools/bays are not yet allotted to the console.
